text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot Thai kitchen so green 
curry is one of the most classic dishes in Thai

cuisine it was actually one of the very first 
video I made for hot Thai Kitchen some of you

may still remember but I've never actually shown 
you how to make the green curry paste from scratch

I've actually had lots of different requests for 
it so today is the day ladies and gentlemen I'm

showing you how to make green curry paste let's 
get started so making curry paste is all about

using the right ingredients kay so I'm going to 
go through all the ingredients in the process is

really simple so green chilies this is why green 
curry is green because it's the only curry paste

that actually uses all green chilies all the other 
curries use red dried chilies or red fresh chilies

so that's why it also has a unique flavor so these 
are green Thai chilies and they're really really

spicy these are frozen I keep my chilies frozen 
I've also got some kaffir lime zest if you don't

have kaffir lime zest you can just grate in a 
little bit of lime zest or if you have the leaves

you can just put the leaves in the curry we have 
with kaffir lime leaves in the curry paste because

they're really tough and hard to grind okay so 
it's also frozen I've got some cilantro roots okay

if you don't have cilantro roots you can use stems 
instead I've got some lemongrass and I'm only

using the bottom half which is where the flavors 
most concentrated some galangal okay so all these

are frozen Thai basil leaves this is actually 
optional it's what I like to add to make my curry

paste more rich in its green color without making 
it too spicy I could add more chilies whether

that are you really spicy right on this side we've 
got some shallots I've got some garlic which I've

also chopped up dry spices I have cumin seeds and 
coriander seeds which I have toasted then I have

some white peppercorns some salt and some shrimp 
paste so this is fermented shrimp paste or what

we call guppy it comes in a jar like this and you 
can get it at a lot of Asian grocery stores don't

confuse this with the other kind of shrimp paste 
which is orange and in oil bath shrimp tamale okay

but in English it also say shrimp paste if you 
don't have it you can leave it out if you want to

make it vegetarian you can also add a little bit 
of miso paste if you like it just adds a boost of

umami flavor it's pungent you know ingredient but 
when added to dishes in small amounts it really

really boosts it up a little bit and that is it 
now I'm going to go and chop all of my tough herbs

I wanted to show them in whole so you can see it 
but before I start pounding it in my morton pestle

this is going to take me a really long time 
to pound so I'm going to go and chop all them

up till they're fine and the chilies I'm actually 
going to remove the seeds and the pith from about

half of the chili so that my pace is not too 
too spicy so chop chop chop and I'll be right

back all right I'm going to go old school and use 
a mortar and pestle however if you want to use an

electric device blenders you probably need to add 
a little liquid to make it go food processors you

probably need to make more than this otherwise 
it'll just like stick to the sides later we'll

just spin the only thing I found that works well 
with a small amount is a stick immersion blender

so if you have one of those give that a try but I 
like using my mortar and pestle for this so first

I'm going to do my dry spices so my cumin seeds 
coriander seeds white peppercorns and this part

you can do in a coffee grinder if you like alright 
pour this out into another bowl because if I leave

the dry stuff in there it's going to act a bit 
like a cushion and the rest of the stuff doesn't

grind quite as well so next I'm going to add my 
Chili's because the Chili's I find is the hardest

thing to grind finely because of the skin and to 
help add a little friction I'm going to use salt

ideally I use coarse salt for this but Oh we'll go 
get that nice and fine once that's nice and fine

I'm going to now add the Thai basil mmm it was 
like Thai basil pesto right now and then all of

these herbs are going to go in so these are what 
I call the sturdy herbs I should point out that at

any point if you feel like it's getting a little 
too wet and it meets a little more friction that's

what your dry spices are therefore you just add 
a little bit and helps absorb any of the liquid

in there so it doesn't splash just like that nice 
and fine huh it's a good workout all right we're

almost done so shallots and garlic going in and 
then again at any point you feel like it needs a

little friction at your dry spices and every once 
in a while I like to just scrape it with a rubber

spatula almost there now it's nice and fine all my 
dry spices are in the last thing that's going in

is the shrimp paste mmm this is when it starts to 
smell good this is the greenest curry paste ever

because I'm going to tell you right now when you 
buy green curry paste from the store they don't

add the little extra greenness from the Thai basil 
leaf so this would be extra green curry paste now

in my green curry video I show you a trick where 
I blend Thai basil and add it to the curry to

boost the to boost the color if you already 
have Thai basil in your page you won't need

to do that okay that trick works well when you 
store-bought curry paste the colors a little bit

dull and that is it and this is the part where 
I would normally taste my finished product and

tell you what it tastes like but I don't think 
I'll be doing that today with this thing and by

the way if you make a lot of curry paste any kind 
of curry paste it will freeze for a long time so

I will put the recipe for my green curry chicken 
right here in the cars but you can also use this

to make my green curry rice balls green curry 
fried rice lots of different things you can do

with green curry paste so the full recipe will be 
on hot Thai Kitchen calm when you make it send me

a photo well you don't have to send me a photo 
of the page but then your photo of the thing

you use the base for that'll be great you can 
sign either photo place two and if you haven't

subscribed to the show please do so right here and 
I'll see you next time for your next delicious pie
